data.value: Specifies the dimension along which to propagate values when filling.

The maximum number of consecutive NaN values to forward fill. In other words, if there is a gap with more than this number of consecutive NaNs, it will only be partially filled. Must be greater than 0 or None for no limit. Must be None or greater than or equal to axis length if filling along chunked axes (dimensions).
Fill NaN values by propagating values forward

data.out:
<xarray.DataArray (Y: 5, X: 3)>
array([[nan,  1.,  3.],
       [ 0., nan,  5.],
       [ 5., nan, nan],
       [ 3., nan, nan],
       [ 0.,  2.,  0.]])
Coordinates:
    lat      (Y) float64 -20.0 -20.25 -20.5 -20.75 -21.0
    lon      (X) float64 10.0 10.25 10.5
Dimensions without coordinates: Y, X

<xarray.DataArray (Y: 5, X: 3)>
array([[nan,  1.,  3.],
       [ 0.,  1.,  5.],
       [ 5.,  1.,  5.],
       [ 3.,  1.,  5.],
       [ 0.,  2.,  0.]])
Coordinates:
    lat      (Y) float64 -20.0 -20.25 -20.5 -20.75 -21.0
    lon      (X) float64 10.0 10.25 10.5
Dimensions without coordinates: Y, X

data.value: Fill only the first of consecutive NaN values:
